go_data.justification: CD11a is part of the beta2 family of integrins, which are expressed on most leukocytes and play a role in cell adhesion and migration.
CD11a, as a beta2 integrin, is involved in cell adhesion, as blocking mAbs to CD18, alphad, or alpha4 integrins reduced adhesion to background levels.
CD11a is an alpha subunit of the beta2 integrin family and binds to beta2 integrins to form a functional complex.
CD11a is expressed on the surface of leukocytes, including eosinophils, neutrophils, and basophils, indicating its location in the plasma membrane.
